subtitles_text: >> JEFF PROBST: Previously on
Survivor... Here in Samoa, the purple tribe,
Galu, has been on a roll... Galu wins!
...winning all three immunity challenges.
At camp, most of the tribe kicked back and relaxed, while
Shambo did most of the work. >> I'm not doing the warm and
fuzzy. I'm doing the Rambo-Shambo
provider role out here. >> PROBST: In a twist, Shambo
was sent to observe the other tribe.
>> We call you McDreamy. >> Pleasure.
>> PROBST: And she immediately bonded with everyone.
At Foa Foa, Russell was a force to be reckoned with.
>> I'm running this whole show right now.
>> PROBST: He constantly manipulated the others to
further his own ends. >> I'm going to have them all
under control like zombies walking around.
>> PROBST: As the yellow tribe was preparing to go to their
third Tribal Council in a row... >> He was...
>> If I was a girl, I would slap you, is what I would do.
>> PROBST: ...Jaison got furious at Ben because of his
racially-insensitive comments. >> PROBST: Jaison wanted Ben
out, but Russell didn't agree. >> Right now, I think I need
Ben. >> PROBST: At Tribal Cou
Ben wouldn't back down. >> She is from the ghetto, and
she's trashy. That's ghetto trash.
That's not racial. >> PROBST: So Jaison stood up to
him. >> If what you're telling me is
that what you said had absolutely no racial context,
then maybe you are ignorant. >> PROBST: During the
confrontation, Russell realized his best play was to vote off
Ben. >> I didn't want to have to do
this, man. >> PROBST: Ben became the fourth
member of Foa Foa to leave the game.
Now the tribe is down in numbers and morale.
16 are left. Who will be voted out tonight?
>> Yeah. >> What happened at Tribal
Council was me trying to let Ben know how I felt.
I cannot handle people who use terms and phrases that are meant
to hurt on a very basic level. >> Jaison, there's room here,
too. >> Man!
I'm hungry, and I'm tired. I came here to have an
adventure, but, frankly, I, right now, believe that coming
here was the worst decision I've made in my entire life.
>> It's draining, man. It's not only physically tough.
It's mentally tough. It messes with your mind, your
body and your soul. Coming back from Tribal last
night, Jaison was really upset with Ben.
You know, he took things very personal.
I really think that if Ben would have stayed, Jaison would have
quit the game. Now, what kind of man is that?
>> Yeah, dude. >> Yeah?
>> Now I'm willing to get rid of Jaison, and whoever I want to be
gone is going to be gone. I've got it all under my thumb
right now. \xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa
>> I got back at Galu last night, and I'm not happy,
because when I went over to Foa Foa, there was a huge
appreciation for Shambo, huge appreciation.
Their camp is amazing, you guys. Fresh water, white sand beaches.
No coral, you can go barefoot. Everybody over there loved me.
I feel ten times closer to Foa Foa than I do Galu, because
Galu-- they just want to lay on the beach and gossip.
So, I don't have no problem going to Foa Foa, because I
already have a following there, and if I can make it to the
merge, I know damn well I've got their vote, so I'm way ahead.
>> Yas got a clue for the immunity idol.
>> Okay. >> You got a clue for the
immunity idol. >> Absolutely.
>> Wherever the immunity idol is on their beach, it's
probably on our beach. Nobody really got to talk to
Shambo last night about the second clue to the immunity
idol, right? So I come up with this little
idea to find out all the information I want to get from
her. (Shambo sighs)
If I can find the immunity idol, I can give it to you if
you're in danger. >> Yup.
>> At least you'll have that. I'm, like, 30 seconds away from
nailing all the information I want to get from her, and here
comes John, and he stops, and, like, "Hey, Shambo."
Like he has this brilliant idea. >> You got a clue, and Yasmin
had a clue. >> I got her clue and my clue.
>> What was Yasmin's clue? >> Yasmin's clue was, "You'll
find what you seek in the bark." And the second one is, "It's
low to the ground." Those were the exact words.
If it comes down to jury trial, you guys better give me the
vote for giving you honesty on this question.
>> Well, listen, if um... If we can...
>> And if you don't, bad on you. Got to go.
I don't feel like I've hurt myself in the game in any way,
shape, or form by sharing knowledge with them.
That can do nothing but help me going forward.
And-And maybe it won't. Maybe it will hurt me, but
we'll see. >> Tree mail.
>> Uh-oh. >> And it says, "The chief must
choose two to join him on a quest to go on a special mission
which could turn out for the best.
And when your chief comes home..."
>> Oh! >> "...your tribe might have
more to eat..." >> Oh!
>> "...but you won't know why until the mission is complete."
>> Basically, they just want one guy, one girl.
We just got some tree mail, and it says that I need to choose
two people to go on a mission, which may or may not lead to us
having a little bit more food. Obviously, you want to bring
people that are strong in some sort of challenge situation.
So I'll be taking Russell, because he is good at
strategizing, and Natalie is good with puzzles, things of
that nature. So I thought it was perfect.
Everybody's comfortable with this?
>> That's fine, yup. >> Yup, yup.
>> Let's do this. >> Have to choose two people to
go on a quest with me, so I took Shambo and Dave because I need
some-some brains and some firepower.
Here comes Foa Foa. >> So we're just sitting there
looking at each other. You know, we're waiting for
Jeff, 'cause at every challenge so far, Jeff has always been
there. So we're, like, what do we do?
>> So what's going on? >> I don't know.
>> Let's lay an egg. (indistinct chatter)
>> Oh, my word. >> Oh, chickens.
>> Oh, my God. >> Who knows what's in the
other one. >> Nah. It's probably rice and
beans. >> Oh, if you catch the chicken,
you get the pirate chest full of food.
Ha, ha. >> Maybe so.
>> I don't think that's what it is.
>> Some kind of swap? >> I think so, too.
>> I wonder if we're just supposed to jump, like just get
over there and start doing stuff without even asking.
(clucking) >> Wait.
>> A reward challenge. "For today's challenge, you'll
be left on your own to battle for reward inside this box... "
Suddenly, it was on. The frenzy was on.
Shambo's grabbing chickens, we're jumping into the treasure
box, and it's got all these colored balls, and it's got some
instructions. >> Oh, all right, Sham, the
reward cannot be opened and-and shared between tribes...
Sham, put those chickens back and come on back.
>> Hey, put the chicken back, quick.
>> Take 'em back. Take' em back. Take them chickens back.
>> Okay, so what is the deal? >> Uh... "For today's challenge,
you will be left on your own to battle for reward.
Inside this box are a flag and three tribe-colored balls for
each player. One player will place the flag
in the center of the beach. One at a time, you will toss a
ball toward the flag. The object is to land your ball
closest to the flag. Once all the balls have been
thrown, the ball closest to the flag wins."
>> Boccie ball. >> It's like boccie ball.
>> It's boccie ball, horseshoes. >> All right.
Oh, reward challenge. Awesome!
It's basically like a game of boccie ball.
The tribe that wins gets to take these chickens home.
>> So, we'll start with the chiefs, so you start first.
>> All right. >> Yeah.
>> Then I'll start. >> Chiefs first, ladies
second... >> Chiefs first.
>> And the esteemed gentleman... >> Yeah, that's fine.
>> All right, cheers. >> All right.
>> All right, let's do this. >> All right.
>> Let's go, Mick. Oh, good shot, Mick.
>> Good job, Mick. Good job. You got this one, chief.
>> That was a good one, too. Ah!
>> Mm. >> So close.
>> Wow. >> Yes!
>> Oh, son of a... >> Yes!
>> Oh, God. >> Russell's ball knocks mine
closest, and I can taste the chicken in my mouth.
>> Wow. >> Good shot, Mick.
>> Oh! >> Oh!
>> Stay out of his way now. Make sure you don't hit it.
>> Mick had thrown those last two balls so close to the stick.
My goal was to, like, not even get close to him, because I
didn't want to mess anything up. Oh, no.
Sorry, guys. >> Nice.
>> Aah! >> All right, you're up.
>> I'm going to knock him out of there.
>> Get one in. >> Mm.
>> Oop. Too strong. >> Aim right for that stick.
>> Oh, my God, I'm a mess. >> Try knocking his out.
>> That's what I'm going for. >> Oh!
>> Oh! >> Oh!
>> There we go. >> Nice!
>> Nice hit. (grunting)
>> Oh, Shannon Lee. Lord have mercy.
>> We're panicking all over the place.
Shambo was, like, no good. >> Dang!
>> So now it's between Russell from Foa Foa and Dave.
And each has three shots to win this game.
>> All right, Russell, we need you.
>> Good job, Russell. >> All right, you're up, Dave.
Not bad, not bad. >> Ooh...
>> Gosh. >> Ooh.
>> Yes, that puts two in the way.
>> All right, Russell, nice and easy.
>> Don't knock anything out. You got it, man, you got it.
>> Ooh... >> Dear God.
>> Nice shooting, Tex. >> That might get it done, so
you're gonna have to get at the stick.
>> Just drop it on it. >> All right.
>> So, Dave's got his final ball.
We've got the closest ball to the flag.
I'm looking over at the chickens like I'm stoked.
This is finally gonna be something we can bring back.
We're finally gonna win. >> Come on, Dave, you can do it.
>> All right, so this one wins, Dave.
>> Shh. The last ball-- it is on me.
Make it or break it. 'Cause at this point, we are not
going home with the chickens. >> Oh, no.
(several shouting) >> Oh, my God!
>> Yes! >> Yes!
(both grunt) Good game.
>> Good game, guys. >> Oh, my God.
>> Good shot. >> Thank you, man.
Thank you very much. >> Oh, man.
It's so demoralizing. I'm just so tired of losing to
these guys. It totally split me in half to
see Galu walk off with those chickens.
It's so ludicrous that we can't even pull off frickin' boccie
ball. \xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa
>> Thank goodness Russell didn't take me to the challenge today,
because now with him gone, I can get people doing things, working
for the tribe, while I stay home and find that immunity idol.
>> I got ten minutes to try to find an idol that apparently is
in the bark of a tree. \xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa
(grunts) Yes, yes, yes, yes, yes, yes!
Yes! (whispers): Oh, it's so
beautiful. (exhales)
Of course, I'm not gonna tell anybody I got the idol, but I'm
gonna use it down the road. Maybe around day 30, 36.
'Cause I plan on being here for a while, and this is gonna be my
ticket. >> You're the man, dude.
You brought it on home. >> Hey, man, it was your ball I
hit-- team effort, Daddy. Seriously.
>> I'll tell you, the chickens, they're heavy, but they're worth
every aching muscle. Carrying that chicken coop felt
great coming home. Every time it scraped against
the back of my ankles, I thought, "That's okay, we're
bringing home the bacon, baby." Do you know anything about
chickens, Shannon? >> We need somebody who isn't
gonna accidentally let them out. >> Yeah.
We're back! >> You're home?!
>> We won the challenge! >> You did?!
>> We come bearing gifts! >> It's Russell!
>> We're bringing friends! We're gonna have eggs every
morning! (happy shouts, laughing)
>> We won! >> Yeah!
>> We won! We won! >> I won chickens.
On the inside... We win! We win! Yes!
However, I'm just trying to stay emotionally centered and humble
within the tribe. 'Cause getting cocky is a quick
way to show me the door. >> Come on, guys, over here!
Come on! >> However, I won chickens.
What did you do? Not that. Peace.
>> All right, so this is Daisy, Ella and Millie.
"We lay eggs and like to eat coconut."
>> And they got to have fresh water all the time.
>> Hey, you're on it. I've already assigned it to you.
>> I don't claim to be a chicken farmer, but I was introduced to
them at a very young age, and you got to have a relationship
with chickens. They're very finicky, they have
to trust you, they have to know you, they have to like you.
The Survivor chickens will know Shambo, and they will give me
eggs in turn, because I will be kind to them.
(Shambo clucking) (chickens clucking)
(Shambo clucking) >> Talking chicken.
(clucking) \xe2\x99\xaa \xe2\x99\xaa
(thunder crashes) >> Mick and Natalie and Russ,
they lost the challenge. I think normally I'd say I was
hungry for a win, but I just want to survive to another day.
I'm tired. I'm hungry. You know? I'm really thirsty.
So for me right now, it doesn't really matter.
>> My true alliance, it changes all the time.
I told Jaison I'd bring him to the top two.
But I don't know that I can count on Jaison to stay in the
game. I need somebody to be able to
help me to the final two. So I would have to take somebody
like Natalie with me. Because she's gonna ride my
coattails the whole way. I mean, she's too stupid to do
it by herself. She needs me.
So I could stand up there and say, "She followed my coattails
this whole way. She rode me like a horse."
(laughs) >> Day one still exists.
It's gonna be me and you in the final.
>> That's right. >> You're probably gonna get

gonna get their hearts broken and you're gonna be one of the
ones doing it to 'em. >> Russell and I have talked
about, since the first day, about being the final two at the
end, so at this point, I'm kind of his wingman, I guess you
could say. >> You're good... you're good
for a long while. >> I definitely think people
underestimate me, and I want them to think that, hey, it's
really smart for them to take me to the end because they can beat

advantage. And if it comes down to me or
him, 'cause I know I can beat Russell in the very end, 'cause
I would say a lot of other people in the tribe have really
been rubbed the wrong way by him.
So I'm just trying to not ruffle feathers, steer clear,
build good relationships, which is what I'm good at.

That's the worst part. Is anybody looking for the damn

>> Every time I try to take a nap, Erik interrupts me.
>> Uh-uh. >> Ugh!
Hmm. All right, I'll be back.
>> Bye. I am so sick of Yas doing
absolutely nothing. She's, like, waiting around to

But Yas is here for herself. She's not a team player.

And say we do lose a challenge. I think Yas would be the first

Galu getting your first look at the new Foa Foa.
Ben voted out at the last Tribal Council.
All right, you guys ready to get to today's challenge?

Brett, take back the immunity idol.
Thank you. Once again, immunity is back up
for grabs. For today's challenge, you will
race across a net run carrying wooden blocks.
When you reach the platform, you must stack the blocks one
on top of the other. Once you've completed the stack,
you'll make your way across a rope bridge to another platform
where you will find more blocks. This will stack even higher.
The first tribe to get both stacks completed wins immunity,
is safe from the vote. Losers-- Tribal Council, where
somebody will be voted out of this game.
Galu, you have four extra members-- sitting four people

>> I'm going to sit out Sham, Laura, Dave and myself.
>> PROBST: All right, you guys take a spot on the bench.

Survivors ready? Go!
John out quickly for Galu. Liz out for Foa Foa.

Everybody doing very well. (whooping)
Once all your members are back on the mat, you can start

>> PROBST: You're building one tall stack.
